AttachInstances.document:
This API is used to add existing instances to the compute environment. Requirements:
1. The instance is not in the batch compute system.
2. The instance is in “Running” status.
3. Spot instances are not supported. For instances added to the compute environment, their UserData will be reset, and the operating systems will be reinstalled.
AttachInstances.name: Adds instances to the compute environment

CreateComputeEnv.document: This API is used to create a compute environment.
CreateComputeEnv.name: Creates a compute environment

CreateTaskTemplate.document: This API is used to create a task template.
CreateTaskTemplate.name: Creates a task template

DeleteComputeEnv.document: This API is used to delete a compute environment.
DeleteComputeEnv.name: Deletes a compute environment

DeleteJob.document:
This API is used to delete a job.
When a job is deleted, all related information is deleted and the job cannot be queried.
To delete a job, the job and all its task instances must be in SUCCEED or FAILED status.
DeleteJob.name: Deletes a job

DeleteTaskTemplates.document: This API is used to delete task template information.
DeleteTaskTemplates.name: Deletes a task template

DescribeAvailableCvmInstanceTypes.document: This API is used to view the information of available CVM model configurations.
DescribeAvailableCvmInstanceTypes.name: Gets the information of CVM model configurations available to BatchCompute

DescribeComputeEnv.document: This API is used to query compute environment details.
DescribeComputeEnv.name: Gets compute environment details

DescribeComputeEnvActivities.document: This API is used to query the information of activities in the compute environment.
DescribeComputeEnvActivities.name: Queries the information of activities in the compute environment

DescribeComputeEnvCreateInfo.document: This API is used to query the compute environment creation information.
DescribeComputeEnvCreateInfo.name: Queries the creation information of a compute environment

DescribeComputeEnvCreateInfos.document: This API is used to view the list of information of compute environment creation, including name, description, type, environment parameters, notifications, and number of desired nodes.
DescribeComputeEnvCreateInfos.name: Queries the list of compute environment creation information

DescribeComputeEnvs.document: This API is used to get the list of compute environments.
DescribeComputeEnvs.name: Gets the list of compute environments

DescribeCvmZoneInstanceConfigInfos.document: This API is used to get the model configuration information of the availability zone of BatchCompute.
DescribeCvmZoneInstanceConfigInfos.name: Gets the model configuration information of the availability zone of BatchCompute

DescribeInstanceCategories.document: Currently, CVM instance families are classified into different category, and each category contains several instance families. This API is used to query the instance category information.
DescribeInstanceCategories.name: Queries instance category information

DescribeJob.document: This API is used to query the details of a job, including internal task (`Task`) and dependency (`Dependence`) information.
DescribeJob.name: Queries job details

DescribeJobSubmitInfo.document: This API is used to query the submission information of the specified job, with the return including the job submission information used as input parameters in the JobId and SubmitJob APIs.
DescribeJobSubmitInfo.name: Queries job submission information

DescribeJobs.document: This API is used to query the overview information of several jobs.
DescribeJobs.name: Queries the list of jobs

DescribeTask.document: This API is used to query the details of a specified task, including information of the task instances inside the task.
DescribeTask.name: Queries task details

DescribeTaskLogs.document: This API is used to get the standard outputs and standard error logs of multiple task instances.
DescribeTaskLogs.name: Queries task log details

DescribeTaskTemplates.document: This API is used to query the information of task templates.
DescribeTaskTemplates.name: Queries task templates

DetachInstances.document: This API is used to remove instances that from compute environment.
DetachInstances.name: Removes instances from the compute environment

ModifyComputeEnv.document: This API is used to modify the attributes of a compute environment.
ModifyComputeEnv.name: Modifies a compute environment

ModifyTaskTemplate.document: This API is used to modify a task template.
ModifyTaskTemplate.name: Modifies a task template

RetryJobs.document:
This API is used to retry the failed task instances in a job.
Job retry is supported only if a job is in the "FAILED" state. After the retry operation succeeds, the job will retry the failing task instances in each task in turn according to the task dependencies specified in the "DAG". The history information of the task instances will be reset, the instances will participate in subsequent scheduling and execution as if they are run for the first time.
RetryJobs.name: Retries jobs

TerminateComputeNode.document:
This API is used to terminate a compute node.
Termination is allowed for nodes in the CREATED, CREATION_FAILED, RUNNING or ABNORMAL state.
TerminateComputeNode.name: Terminates a compute node

TerminateComputeNodes.document: This API is used to terminate compute nodes in batches. It is not allowed to repeatedly terminate the same node.
TerminateComputeNodes.name: Batch terminates the compute nodes

TerminateJob.document:
This API is used to terminate a job.
Termination is prohibited if a job is in the `SUBMITTED` state and does not take effect if it is in the `SUCCEED` state.
Job termination is an asynchronous process, and the time it takes to complete the entire process is directly proportional to the total number of tasks. The effect of terminating a job is equivalent to performing the TerminateTaskInstance operation on all the task instances contained in the job. For more information on the specific effect and usage, see TerminateTaskInstance.
TerminateJob.name: Terminates a job

TerminateTaskInstance.document:
This API is used to terminate a task instance.
`SUCCEED` and `FAILED` task instances: No action
`SUBMITTED`, `PENDING`, and `RUNNABLE` task instances: Change status to `FAILED`.
`STARTING`, `RUNNING` and `FAILED_INTERRUPTED` task instances: If `EnvId` is not specified, the CVM instance is terminated, and then the task status goes to `FAILED`. If `EnvId` is specified, the task instance changes to `FAILED`, then the related CVM instance is restarted. 
`FAILED_INTERRUPTED` task instances: The related resources and quotas will be released only after the termination actually succeeds.
TerminateTaskInstance.name: Terminates a task instance

Activity.document: Information of the creation/termination activity of a compute node

members.document: Delivery form of the application. Values: `PACKAGE` (package stored in a remote location), `LOCAL` (local computer).
members.name: DeliveryForm

members.document: Remote storage path of the application package
members.name: PackagePath

members.document: Relevant configuration of the Docker used by the application. In case that the Docker configuration is used, "LOCAL" DeliveryForm means that the application software inside the Docker image is used directly and run in Docker mode; "PACKAGE" DeliveryForm means that the remote application package is run in Docker mode after being injected into the Docker image. To avoid compatibility issues with different versions of Docker, the Docker installation package and relevant dependencies are taken care of by BatchCompute. For custom images where Docker has already been installed, uninstall Docker first and then use the Docker feature.
members.name: Docker

members.document: Data disk size (in GB). The minimum adjustment increment is 10 GB. The value range varies by data disk type. For more information on limits, see [Storage Overview](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/213/4952?from_cn_redirect=1). The default value is 0, indicating that no data disk is purchased. For more information, see the product documentation.
members.name: DiskSize

members.document:
Data disk type. For restrictions on data disk types, refer to [Storage Overview](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/213/4952?from_cn_redirect=1). Valid values:
  • LOCAL_BASIC: local disk.
  • LOCAL_SSD: local SSD.
  • LOCAL_NVME: local NVMe disk, which is closely related to InstanceType, and cannot be specified.
  • LOCAL_PRO: local HDD, which is closely related to InstanceType, and cannot be specified.
  • CLOUD_BASIC: basic cloud disk.
  • CLOUD_PREMIUM: premium cloud disk.
  • CLOUD_SSD: cloud SSD.
  • CLOUD_HSSD: enhanced SSD.
  • CLOUD_TSSD: tremendous SSD.
  • CLOUD_BSSD: balanced SSD.

    Default value: LOCAL_BASIC.

    This parameter is invalid for the `ResizeInstanceDisk` API.
members.name: DiskType

members.document:
Data disk ID. Note that it’s not available for `LOCAL_BASIC` and `LOCAL_SSD` disks.
It is only used as a response parameter for APIs such as `DescribeInstances`, and cannot be used as a request parameter for APIs such as `RunInstances`.
members.name: DiskId

members.document:
Whether a data disk is terminated when the associated CVM instance is terminated. Valid values:
  • TRUE: The data disk is terminated when the associated CVM instance is terminated. This only supports pay-as-you-go cloud disks that are billed by hour.
  • FALSE: The data disk is retained when the associated CVM instance is terminated.
    Default value: TRUE.
    This parameter is currently used only in the `RunInstances` API.
    • Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid value is found.
members.name: DeleteWithInstance

members.document:
Data disk snapshot ID. The size of the selected data disk snapshot must be smaller than that of the data disk.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid value is found.
members.name: SnapshotId

members.document:
Whether a data disk is encrypted. Valid values:
  • true: encrypted.
  • false: not encrypted.
    Default value: false.
    This parameter is currently used only in the `RunInstances` API.
    • Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid value is found.
members.name: Encrypt

members.document:
ID of the custom CMK in the format of UUID or “kms-abcd1234”. This parameter is used to encrypt cloud disks.

Currently, this parameter is only used in the `RunInstances` API.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: KmsKeyId

Cloud disk performance, in MB/s
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ThroughputPerformance

EnhancedService.document: Describes the configuration of enhanced services, such as Cloud Security and Cloud Monitor.

members.document: Enables cloud security service. If this parameter is not specified, the cloud security service will be enabled by default.
members.name: SecurityService

members.document: Enables cloud monitor service. If this parameter is not specified, the cloud monitor service will be enabled by default.
members.name: MonitorService

members.document: Whether to enable the TAT service. If this parameter is not specified, the TAT service is enabled for public images and disabled for other images by default.
members.name: AutomationService

members.name: InstanceType

members.name: SystemDisk

members.name: DataDisks

members.document: Information of the VPC configuration. It cannot be specified together with `Zones` and `VirtualPrivateClouds`.
members.name: VirtualPrivateCloud

members.document: Security groups associated with the instance
members.name: SecurityGroupIds

members.document: Whether to activate CWPP agent and Cloud Monitor. CWPP agent and Cloud Monitor are activated by default.
members.name: EnhancedService

members.document:
CVM instance billing method
  • `POSTPAID_BY_HOUR` (default): Hourly-billed pay-as-you-go
  • `SPOTPAID`: Spot instance
members.name: InstanceChargeType

members.document: Market-related options for instances, such as parameters related to spot instances.
members.name: InstanceMarketOptions

members.document: Types of CVM instances to create (up to 10). The system creates compute nodes of types specified in this list from top to down till the creation is successful. It cannot be specified together with `InstanceType` or `InstanceTypeOptions`.
members.name: InstanceTypes

members.document: CVM instance model configuration. It cannot be specified together with `InstanceType` or `InstanceTypes`.
members.name: InstanceTypeOptions

members.document: List of availability zones. You can create CVM cross AZs in the same region. It cannot be specified together with `VirtualPrivateCloud` or `VirtualPrivateClouds`.
members.name: Zones

members.document: List of VPCs (creation of CVM instances across VPCs is supported). It cannot be specified together with `VirtualPrivateCloud` or `Zones`.
members.name: VirtualPrivateClouds

members.document:
Event type. Value range:
  • `JOB_RUNNING`: The job is running, applicable to `SubmitJob`.
  • `JOB_SUCCEED`: The job succeeded, applicable to `SubmitJob`.
  • `JOB_FAILED`: The job failed, applicable to `SubmitJob`.
  • `JOB_FAILED_INTERRUPTED`: The job failed and the instance is retained, applicable to `SubmitJob`.
  • `TASK_RUNNING`: The task is running, applicable to `SubmitJob`.
  • `TASK_SUCCEED`: The task succeeded, applicable to `SubmitJob`.
  • `TASK_FAILED`: The task failed, applicable to `SubmitJob`.
  • `TASK_FAILED_INTERRUPTED`: The task failed and the instance is retained, applicable to `SubmitJob`.
  • `TASK_INSTANCE_RUNNING`: The task instance is running, applicable to `SubmitJob`.
  • `TASK_INSTANCE_SUCCEED`: The task instance succeeded, applicable to `SubmitJob`.
  • `TASK_INSTANCE_FAILED`: The task instance failed, applicable to `SubmitJob`.
  • `TASK_INSTANCE_FAILED_INTERRUPTED`: The task instance failed and the instance is retained, applicable to `SubmitJob`.
  • `COMPUTE_ENV_CREATED`: the compute environment has been created, applicable to "CreateComputeEnv".
  • `COMPUTE_ENV_DELETED`: The compute environment has been deleted, applicable to `CreateComputeEnv`.
  • `COMPUTE_NODE_CREATED`: The compute node has been created, applicable to `CreateComputeEnv` and `SubmitJob`.
  • `COMPUTE_NODE_CREATION_FAILED`: The compute node creation failed, applicable to `CreateComputeEnv` and `SubmitJob`.
  • `COMPUTE_NODE_RUNNING`: The compute node is running, applicable to `CreateComputeEnv` and `SubmitJob`.
  • `COMPUTE_NODE_ABNORMAL`: The compute node is exceptional, applicable to "CreateComputeEnv" and "SubmitJob".
  • `COMPUTE_NODE_DELETING`: The compute node has been deleted, applicable to `CreateComputeEnv` and `SubmitJob`.
members.name: EventName

members.document:
Release address
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid value is found.
members.name: ReleaseAddress

members.document:
Not supported network. Value:
  • BASIC: classic network
  • VPC1.0: VPC1.0 Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: UnsupportNetworks

members.document:
Attributes of local HDD storage
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid value is found.
members.name: StorageBlockAttr

Filter.document:
> Key-value pair filters used for conditional queries, such as filtering results by ID, name, and state.
> * If there are multiple `Filter` parameters, they are evaluated using the logical `AND` operator.
> * If a `Filter` contains multiple `Values`, they are evaluated using the logical `OR` operator.
>
> Take [DescribeInstances](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/213/15728?from_cn_redirect=1) as an example. You can use the following filters to query the instances in availability zone (`zone`) Guangzhou Zone 1 ***and*** whose billing plan (`instance-charge-type`) is pay-as-you-go:
```
Filters.0.Name=zone
&Filters.0.Values.0=ap-guangzhou-1
&Filters.1.Name=instance-charge-type
&Filters.1.Values.0=POSTPAID_BY_HOUR
```

members.document:
Spot-related options
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: SpotOptions

members.document:
Market type. Valid value: `spot`.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: MarketType

InstanceTypeConfig.document: Information of InstanceTypeConfig available to BatchCompute

members.document:
Instance billing plan. Valid values:
  • POSTPAID_BY_HOUR: pay after use. You are billed for your traffic by the hour.
  • `CDHPAID`: [`CDH`](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/416?from_cn_redirect=1) billing plan. Applicable to `CDH` only, not the instances on the host.
members.name: InstanceChargeType

members.document: ENI type. For example, 25 represents an ENI of 25 GB.
members.name: NetworkCard

members.document:
Additional data.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid value is found.
members.name: Externals

members.document: Number of CPU cores of an instance model.
members.name: Cpu

members.document: List of local disk specifications. If the parameter returns null, it means that local disks cannot be created.
members.name: LocalDiskTypeList

members.document:
Whether an instance model is available. Valid values:
  • SELL: available
  • SOLD_OUT: sold out
members.name: Status

members.document:
Details of out-of-stock items
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: SoldOutReason

members.document: The max packet sending and receiving capability (in 10k PPS).
members.name: InstancePps

members.document: Number of GPUs of the instance.
members.name: Gpu

members.document: Number of FPGAs of the instance.
members.name: Fpga

members.document: CPU clock rate of the instance
members.name: Frequency

InternetAccessible.document: Describes the accessibility of an instance in the public network, including its network billing method, maximum bandwidth, etc.

members.document:
Network connection billing plan. Valid value:
  • TRAFFIC_POSTPAID_BY_HOUR: pay after use. You are billed for your traffic, by the hour.
members.name: InternetChargeType

members.document: The maximum outbound bandwidth of the public network, in Mbps. The default value is 0 Mbps. The upper limit of bandwidth varies for different models. For more information, see [Purchase Network Bandwidth](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/213/12523?from_cn_redirect=1).
members.name: InternetMaxBandwidthOut

members.document:
Whether to allocate a public IP address. Valid values:
  • true: Allocate a public IP address.
  • false: Do not allocate a public IP address.

    • When the public network bandwidth is greater than 0 Mbps, you can choose whether to enable the public IP address. The public IP address is enabled by default. When the public network bandwidth is 0, allocating the public IP address is not supported. This parameter is only used as an input parameter in the RunInstances API.
members.name: PublicIpAssigned

members.document: Bandwidth package ID. To obatin the IDs, you can call [`DescribeBandwidthPackages`](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/215/19209?from_cn_redirect=1) and look for the `BandwidthPackageId` fields in the response.
members.name: BandwidthPackageId

members.document:
The original unit price for pay-as-you-go mode in USD.
  • When a billing tier is returned, it indicates the price fo the returned billing tier. For example, if `UnitPriceSecondStep` is returned, it refers to the unit price for the usage between 0 to 96 hours. Otherwise, it refers to that the unit price for unlimited usage. Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: UnitPrice

members.document:
Billing unit for pay-as-you-go mode. Valid values:
  • HOUR: billed on an hourly basis. It's used for hourly postpaid instances (`POSTPAID_BY_HOUR`).
  • GB: bill by traffic in GB. It's used for postpaid products that are billed by the hourly traffic (`TRAFFIC_POSTPAID_BY_HOUR`). Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: ChargeUnit

members.document:
The original price of a pay-in-advance instance, in USD.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: OriginalPrice

members.document:
Discount price of a prepaid instance, in USD.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: DiscountPrice

members.document:
Percentage of the original price. For example, if you enter "20.0", the discounted price will be 20% of the original price.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Discount

members.document:
The discounted unit price for pay-as-you-go mode in USD.
  • When a billing tier is returned, it indicates the price fo the returned billing tier. For example, if `UnitPriceSecondStep` is returned, it refers to the unit price for the usage between 0 to 96 hours. Otherwise, it refers to that the unit price for unlimited usage. Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: UnitPriceDiscount

members.document:
Original unit price for the usage between 96 to 360 hours in USD. It's applicable to pay-as-you-go mode.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: UnitPriceSecondStep

members.document:
Discounted unit price for the usage between 96 to 360 hours in USD. It's applicable to pay-as-you-go mode.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: UnitPriceDiscountSecondStep

members.document:
Original unit price for the usage after 360 hours in USD. It's applicable to pay-as-you-go mode.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: UnitPriceThirdStep

members.document:
Discounted unit price for the usage after 360 hours in USD. It's applicable to pay-as-you-go mode.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: UnitPriceDiscountThirdStep

members.document:
Original 3-year payment, in USD. This parameter is only available to upfront payment mode.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: OriginalPriceThreeYear

members.document:
Discounted 3-year upfront payment, in USD. This parameter is only available to upfront payment mode.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: DiscountPriceThreeYear

members.document:
Discount for 3-year upfront payment. For example, 20.0 indicates 80% off.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: DiscountThreeYear

members.document:
Original 5-year payment, in USD. This parameter is only available to upfront payment mode.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: OriginalPriceFiveYear

members.document:
Discounted 5-year upfront payment, in USD. This parameter is only available to upfront payment mode.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: DiscountPriceFiveYear

members.document:
Discount for 5-year upfront payment. For example, 20.0 indicates 80% off.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: DiscountFiveYear

members.document:
Original 1-year payment, in USD. This parameter is only available to upfront payment mode.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: OriginalPriceOneYear

members.document:
Discounted 1-year payment, in USD. This parameter is only available to upfront payment mode.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: DiscountPriceOneYear

members.document:
Discount for 1-year upfront payment. For example, 20.0 indicates 80% off.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: DiscountOneYear

members.document:
Location information
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: Placement

members.document:
End time
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: EndTime

members.document:
List of tags bound with the job.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: Tags

members.document: Minimum size of a local disk.
members.name: MinSize

members.document: Maximum size of a local disk.
members.name: MaxSize

members.document:
Whether a local disk is required during purchase. Valid values:
  • REQUIRED: required
  • OPTIONAL: optional
members.name: Required

LoginSettings.document: Describes login settings of an instance.

members.document:
Login password of the instance.
  • Linux instances: 8-16 characters, containing at least two of the following categories: [a-z, A-Z], [0-9] and [()`~!@#$%^&*-+=|{}[]:;',.?/].
  • Windows instances: 12-16 characters, containing at least three of the following categories: [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9] and [()`~!@#$%^&*-+={}[]:;',.?/].

    If this parameter is not specified, a random password will be generated and sent to you via the Message Center.
members.name: Password

members.document: List of key IDs. After an instance is associated with a key, you can access the instance with the private key in the key pair. You can call `DescribeKeyPairs` to obtain `KeyId`. Key and password cannot be specified at the same time. Windows instances do not support keys. Currently, you can only specify one key when purchasing an instance.
members.name: KeyIds

members.document: Whether to keep the original settings of an image. Values: `TRUE` (default), `FALSE`. It cannot be specified together with `Password` or `KeyIds.N`. You can specify this parameter as `TRUE` only when you create an instance using a custom image, a shared image, or an imported image.
members.name: KeepImageLogin

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Mounting point. A valid path (for Linux) for a drive (for Windows, such as "H:\\")
members.name: LocalPath

members.document: File system type. Linux: `EXT3` (default) and `EXT4`. Windows: `NTFS`
members.name: FileSystemType

members.document: Agent running mode; applicable for Windows
members.name: AgentRunningMode

members.document: Policy for inactive nodes. Default: `RECREATE`, which means that instance resources will be re-created periodically for compute nodes where instance creation fails or is abnormally returned.
members.name: ActionIfComputeNodeInactive

members.document: When the instances are failed to be created or returned because of exceptions, the related compute node will retry to create instances periodically. This parameter specifies the maximum retry attempts. The max value is 100 and the default value is `7`.
members.name: ResourceMaxRetryCount

members.document: List of tags to bind with a compute environment. Each compute environment can have up to 10 tags.
members.name: Tags

members.document:
Target of the notification Values: `CMQ`, `TDMQ_CMQ` `CMQ`: Tencent Cloud CMQ (default) `TDMQ_CMQ`: Tencent Cloud TDMQ_CMQ.
Note: CMQ has been discontinued. Please use `TDMQ_CMQ`. See [CMQ Queue Migration to TDMQ for CMQ](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/406/60860?from_cn_redirect=1)
members.name: NotificationTarget

members.document: CMQ topic name which should be valid and associated with a subscription
members.name: TopicName

members.document:
Output mapping options
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: OutputMappingOption

members.document: Size of a worker part, in MB.
members.name: WorkerPartSize

members.document:
The mapped output workspace on the container side for the instance.
`BATCH_WORKSPACE` (Default): The workspace is the workspace defined for the usage of Batch Compute. Batch Compute ensures the isolation between jobs.
`GLOBAL_WORKSPACE`: The workspace is the instance OS space..
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: Workspace

Placement.document: Placement of an instance, including its availability zone, project, host (for CDH products only), master host IP, etc.

members.document: ID of the availability zone where the instance resides. You can call the [DescribeZones](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/213/35071) API and obtain the ID in the returned `Zone` field.
members.name: Zone

members.document: ID of the project to which the instance belongs. This parameter can be obtained from the `projectId` returned by [DescribeProject](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/651/78725?from_cn_redirect=1). If this is left empty, the default project is used.
members.name: ProjectId

members.document: ID list of CDHs from which the instance can be created. If you have purchased CDHs and specify this parameter, the instances you purchase will be randomly deployed on the CDHs.
members.name: HostIds

members.document: The ID of the CDH to which the instance belongs, only used as an output parameter.
members.name: HostId

members.document: Standard output redirection file name, which supports three placeholders: `${BATCH_JOB_ID}`, `${BATCH_TASK_NAME}`, and `${BATCH_TASK_INSTANCE_INDEX}`
members.name: StdoutRedirectFileName

members.document: Standard error redirection file name, which supports three placeholders: `${BATCH_JOB_ID}`, `${BATCH_TASK_NAME}`, and `${BATCH_TASK_INSTANCE_INDEX}`
members.name: StderrRedirectFileName

members.document: Standard output redirection local file name, which supports three placeholders: `${BATCH_JOB_ID}`, `${BATCH_TASK_NAME}`, and `${BATCH_TASK_INSTANCE_INDEX}`
members.name: StdoutLocalFileName

members.document: Standard error redirection local file name, which supports three placeholders: `${BATCH_JOB_ID}`, `${BATCH_TASK_NAME}`, and `${BATCH_TASK_INSTANCE_INDEX}`
members.name: StderrLocalFileName

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Whether to enable the TAT service. Valid values:
  • `TRUE`: yes;
  • `FALSE`: no

    Default: `FALSE`.
members.name: Enabled

RunMonitorServiceEnabled.document: Describes information related to the Cloud Monitor service.

members.document:
Whether to enable [Cloud Monitor](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/248?from_cn_redirect=1). Valid values:
  • TRUE: enable Cloud Monitor
  • FALSE: do not enable Cloud Monitor

    Default value: TRUE.
members.name: Enabled

RunSecurityServiceEnabled.document: Describes information related to the Cloud Security service.

members.document:
Whether to enable [Cloud Security](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/296?from_cn_redirect=1). Valid values:
  • TRUE: enable Cloud Security
  • FALSE: do not enable Cloud Security

    Default value: TRUE.
members.name: Enabled

members.document: Bidding request type. Currently only "one-time" is supported.
members.name: SpotInstanceType

members.document:
Local HDD storage type. Value: LOCAL_PRO.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid value is found.
members.name: Type

members.document:
Minimum capacity of local HDD storage
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid value is found.
members.name: MinSize

members.document:
Maximum capacity of local HDD storage
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid value is found.
members.name: MaxSize

SystemDisk.document: Describes information on the block device where the operating system is stored, i.e., the system disk.

members.document:
System disk type. For more information about the limits of system disk types, please see [Storage Overview](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/213/4952?from_cn_redirect=1). Valid values:
  • LOCAL_BASIC: local disk
  • LOCAL_SSD: local SSD disk
  • CLOUD_BASIC: HDD cloud disk
  • CLOUD_SSD: SSD cloud disk
  • CLOUD_PREMIUM: Premium cloud storage
  • CLOUD_BSSD: Balanced SSD

    The disk currently in stock will be used by default.
members.name: DiskType

members.document:
System disk ID. System disks whose type is `LOCAL_BASIC` or `LOCAL_SSD` do not have an ID and do not support this parameter.
It is only used as a response parameter for APIs such as `DescribeInstances`, and cannot be used as a request parameter for APIs such as `RunInstances`.
members.name: DiskId

members.document: System disk size; unit: GB; default value: 50 GB.
members.name: DiskSize

members.document: ID of the dedicated cluster to which the instance belongs.
members.name: CdcId

members.document:
Tag key
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: Key

members.document:
Tag value
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: Value

members.document: Task name, which should be unique within a job
members.name: TaskName

members.document: Compute environment information. One (and only one) parameter must be specified for ComputeEnv and EnvId.
members.name: ComputeEnv

members.document: Compute environment ID. One (and only one) parameter must be specified for ComputeEnv and EnvId.
members.name: EnvId

members.document: The processing method after the TaskInstance fails; Value range: `TERMINATE` (default), `INTERRUPT`, `FAST_INTERRUPT`.
members.name: FailedAction

members.document: The maximum number of retries after the task fails. Range: 0 - 5. Default value: 0
members.name: MaxRetryCount

members.document: Timeout period of the task in seconds. Defaults value: 86400
members.name: Timeout

members.document: The maximum number of concurrent tasks. Range: 0 - 200000. There is no limit by default.
members.name: MaxConcurrentNum

members.document: Restarts the compute node after the task is completed. This is suitable for specifying the compute environment for task execution.
members.name: RestartComputeNode

members.document: Maximum number of retry attempts after failing to create computing resources such as the CVM in the task launch process. Default: `0`; Maximum: `100`.
members.name: ResourceMaxRetryCount

members.document:
Standard output log (Base64-encoded, up to 2048 bytes after decompression)
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: StdoutLog

members.document:
Standard error log (Base64-encoded, up to 2048 bytes after decompression)
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: StderrLog

members.document:
Standard output redirection path
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: StdoutRedirectPath

members.document:
Standard error redirection path
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: StderrRedirectPath

members.document:
Standard output redirection file name
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: StdoutRedirectFileName

members.document:
Standard error redirection file name
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: StderrRedirectFileName

members.document: Number of failed and interrupted tasks
members.name: FailedInterruptedCount

members.document:
Exit code after application execution is completed
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: ExitCode

members.document: Task instance state reason. If the task instance fails, the reason for the failure will be logged.
members.name: StateReason

members.document:
The `InstanceId` of the compute node (e.g., CVM instance) where the task instance is running. This field is empty if the task instance is not running or has already been completed and will change when the task instance is retried.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: ComputeNodeInstanceId

members.document:
Start time
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: LaunchTime

members.document:
Running start time
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: RunningTime

members.document:
Task end time
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: EndTime

members.document: Task instance state reason details. If the task instance fails, the reason for the failure will be logged
members.name: StateDetailedReason

members.document: Number of failed and interrupted tasks
members.name: FailedInterruptedCount

members.document:
Tag list bound to the task template.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: Tags

members.document:
End time
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: EndTime

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

VirtualPrivateCloud.document: Describes information on VPC, including subnets, IP addresses, etc.

members.document: VPC ID in the format of `vpc-xxx`. To obtain valid VPC IDs, you can log in to the [console](https://console.cloud.tencent.com/vpc/vpc?rid=1) or call the [DescribeVpcEx](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/215/1372?from_cn_redirect=1) API and look for the `unVpcId` fields in the response. If you specify `DEFAULT` for both `VpcId` and `SubnetId` when creating an instance, the default VPC will be used.
members.name: VpcId

members.document: VPC subnet ID in the format `subnet-xxx`. To obtain valid subnet IDs, you can log in to the [console](https://console.cloud.tencent.com/vpc/subnet?rid=1) or call [DescribeSubnets](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/215/15784?from_cn_redirect=1) and look for the `unSubnetId` fields in the response. If you specify `DEFAULT` for both `SubnetId` and `VpcId` when creating an instance, the default VPC will be used.
members.name: SubnetId

members.document:
Whether it is used as a public gateway. A public gateway can only be used normally when an instance has a public IP address and is in a VPC. Valid values:
  • true: It is used as a public gateway.
  • false: It is not used as a public gateway.
    • Default value: false.
members.name: AsVpcGateway

members.document: Array of VPC subnet IPs. You can use this parameter when creating instances or modifying VPC attributes of instances. Currently you can specify multiple IPs in one subnet only when creating multiple instances at the same time.
members.name: PrivateIpAddresses

members.document: Number of IPv6 addresses randomly generated for the ENI.
members.name: Ipv6AddressCount
